main_definition: A bomb is an explosive device designed to cause destruction or damage when detonated.

meanings_and_examples.example: His boss bombarded him with feedback on the project, but he tried not to take it personally.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A device designed for use in military or violent situations that can explode when triggered
meanings_and_examples.example: The soldiers were cautious around the unexploded bomb they found during their patrol.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Something of high quality or intensity (idiom)
meanings_and_examples.example: She gave him a bomb of praise for his performance in the school play.
The politician was bombing out against his opponent during the debate, trying to sway public opinion.
